Trait description: Number of seed tubers planted in a plot or unit area
Method name: Tubers (seed yams or setts) planted - Counting
Method description: Count the number of tubers (seed yams or setts) planted per plot (unit area)

Variable name: Weight of planted tubers computation/ gm
Trait description: Weight of seed tubers (whole seed yams or setts ) planted in a plot or per unit area. Planting material from a tuber is called sett. Seed tuber could be either small, healthy whole tuber or large tubers cut into pieces (sett)
Method name: Setts or seed yams planted weight - Computation
Method description: Measure the weight of N planted tubers (seed yams or setts) and record the average

Variable name: First sprout emergence time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time to the first sprout (plant) emerge in a plot
Method description: Record date of first spout emergence in a plot
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Variable name: 50% sprout emergence time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time to 50% sprouts (plants) emerge in a plot
Method description: Record date 50% of sprouts in a plot emerged
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Variable name: First sprout emergence time computation in days
Trait description: Time to the first sprout (plant) emerge in a plot
Method description: Compute the number of days required from date of planting to the date first sprout or plant in a plot or unit area emerged
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Variable name: 50% sprout emergence time computation in days
Trait description: Time to 50% sprouts (plants) emerge in a plot
Method description: Compute the number of days required from date of planting to the date 50% of sprouts or plants in a plot emerged
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Trait description: Number of an emerged plants (sprouts) in a plot
Method description: Count the emerged plants (sprouts) per plot every week starting from first plant/sprout emergence date till the last plant or spourt emerge in a plot

Trait description: Proportion of plants /sprouts emerged in a plot
Trait synonyms: ratio of emerged plants or sprouts
Method description: Compute the proportion or ratio of plants/sprouts emerged as the number of emerged plants/sprouts divided by the total number of tubers (seed yam or setts) planted in a plot multiplied by 100

Trait description: Number of well established plants ( plants growing with good vigour and without severe constraints) in a plot
Method description: Take count of well established plants in a plot usually at two months after planting

Trait description: Proportion of plants in a plot well established (plantsgrowing with good vigour and without severe constraints)
Method description: Compute the proportion or ratio of well-established plants in a plot from the total number of tubers (seed yam or setts) planted

Trait description: Emergence of secondary sprouts on a plant
Method description: Record emergence of new secondary sprouts from the planted seed tuber/sett in a plot at three months after planting

Trait description: Color of the sprout (vine and leaves).
Method description: Record the predominant color of the sprouts (plant) per plot at 20 days after emergence

Trait description: Length of sprouted shoots (vines)
Method description: Compute the average sprout length of five representative plants measurement taken in a plot
Formula: [sprout length plant 1"+ "sprout length plant 2"+ "sprout length plant n"]/n, where n is the number of plants or sprounts measurement taken in a plot"

Trait name: Presence of spot on spine base
Trait description: Presence of colored spots at the spine base of sprouted shoots (vine) with spines
Method description: Record of the existance of colored spot at base of spines on a sprout (vine)

Variable name: Spines on sprout presence estimation nominal 0&1
Trait description: Presence of spines on sprout (vines)
Method description: Record absence or presence of spines on a sprout (vine)

Trait description: Hairs on sprout (vines)
Method description: Record existance of hairs on a sprout (vine)

Variable name: First leaf emergence time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time to the first leaf emergence on a plant or sprouted shoot (vine) in a plot
Method name: Time of first leaf emergence on sprouted shoot (vines)-Estimation
Method description: Record time of the first leaf emergence on sprouted shoot (vine)
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Variable name: Time to first leaf emergence computation
Trait description: Time to the first leaf emergence on a plant or sprouted shoot (vine) in a plot
Method name: Times to the first leaf emergence on sprouted shoot (vines)-Computation
Method description: Compute the number of days required from first sprout emergence to the first leaf to emerge on a sprouted shoot (vine) in a plot
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Trait description: Leaf apex shape
Method description: Record leaf apex shape of mature plants in a plot
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Trait description: Leaf shape of plants
Method description: Record leaf shape of mature plants in a plot
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Variable name: Stems per plant computation per plant
Trait description: Number of stems (vines) with leaves and branches per plant
Method description: Compute average of the number of stems (vines) per established plants in a plot
Formula: [number of stems in plant 1"+ "number of stems in plant 2"+ "number of stems in plant n"]/"n", where n is the number of plants stem count taken in a plot"

Trait description: Stem diameter of a mature plant (5 to 6 month old plant)
Method description: Measure the stem diameter at 15 cm above the base of five plants before senescence in a plot and record the average
Formula: [stem diameter of plant 1"+ "stem diameter of plant 2"+ "stem diameter of in plant n"]/"n", where n is the number of plants stem diameter measurment taken in a plot"

Trait description: Internode length
Method description: Measure the internode length of five plants before senescence at 1 meter height and record the average
Formula: [internode length of plant 1"+ "internode length of plant 2"+ "internode length of plant n"]/"n", where n is the number of plants internode length measurment taken in a plot"

Variable name: Number of internodes to first branching computation/plot
Trait name: Number of internodes to first branching
Trait description: Number of internodes to first branchs on a plant
Method description: Compute average number of internodes to first branching of at least five plants internode counts taken in a plot
Formula: [internode number of first branching on plant 1"+ "internode number to first branching on plant 2"+ "internode number to first bracnhing on plant n"]/"n", where n is the number of plants internodes to first branching count in a plot"
Method reference: IITA, Standard Tuber Yield Trial Protocol

Trait description: Intensity of spines on stem (vine) above base of mature plant (5 to 6 month old plant)
Method name: Density of spines on stem base of a plant-Etimation
Method description: Visual assessment of spines on a stem (vine) above the base of mature plants in a plot

Trait description: A tendency of a plant to grow in a certain shape and to attain a certain mature height and spread
Method description: Visual assessment of the tendency of a plant to grow in a certain shape and to attain mature height and spread

Trait description: Organisation or structural arrangements of branchs and leaves distribution giving a specific shape to the above ground part of the plant
Method description: Determination of predominant canopy architecture
Category 4: 4= Long (More than 50% of the tubers sprouted at three month after harvesting time)

Trait description: The vigour of the vine and leaves of the new plant.
Method description: Visual assessment of the plant vigour in a plot at two month after planting

Trait description: Tendency of climbing or trailling
Method description: Record the tendency of vine to twine or climb

Trait description: Twining direction
Method description: Record the twining or climbing direction of the vine

Variable name: Flower initiation time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time of the first flower initiation on a plant/s in a plot or any of the plants in a plot shows the first flower
Method description: Record time (date) of first flower initiation in a plot or the date any of the plants in a plot shows the first flower

Trait description: Time when 50% of the plants flower in a plot
Method description: Record time (date) 50% plants in a plot are having at least one flower/inflorescence

Variable name: End of flowering time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: End of flowering time or when a plant does not produce new flower in a plot
Method description: Record time (date) when the plant does not produce more new flowers in a plot

Variable name: Fower initiation time computation in days
Trait description: Time of the first flower initiation on a plant/s in a plot or any of the plants in a plot shows the first flower
Method description: Computing the number of days required from first sprout emergence to first flower initiation

Trait description: Time when 50% of the plants flower in a plot
Method description: Compute the number of days required from 50% of sprouts in plot emerged to 50% of plants in a plot are having at least one flower/inflorescence

Variable name: End of flowering time computation in days
Trait description: End of flowering time or when a plant does not produce new flower in a plot
Method description: Computing the number of days required from 50% of sprout emergence to when plant does not produce more new flowers.

Trait description: Date crossing or pollination attempted
Method description: Record the date crossing made in particular flower of a plant.

Trait description: Quantity of Female Flowers which has been pollinated using male flower from a monoecious or dioecious parent
Method description: Count the number of pollinated florets per female parent per cross

Trait description: Quantity of Female spikes where flowers has been pollinated using male flower from a monoecious or dioecious parent
Method description: Count the number of pollinated spikes per female parent per cross

Trait description: Abundance or degree of flowering
Method description: Record the abundance or intesity of flowering when more than 50% of the plants are flowered in a plot
Category 1: 0= No flower or bud. No inflorescence and not flowering at all
Category 2: 1= aborted flower. Presence of small or rudimentary inflorescences/flowers that can show an abortion or abscission point at joint of the pedicel
Category 3: 3= Low (flowering is scare with the presence of few flowers mostly less than 10 inflorescences per plant)
Category 4: 5= Moderate (producing some flowers mostly 10-29 inflorescences per plant)
Category 5: 7 = Profuse (plant producing many more flowers mostly 30 to 50 inflorescences per plant)
Category 6: 9 = Extremely pofuse (plant producing with abundant flowring mostly more than 50 inflorescences per plant)

Variable name: First inflorescence initiation time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time of first inflorescence initiation
Method description: Record date when plant/s having the first inflorescence in a plot

Trait description: Time of first inflorescence initiation
Method description: Compute the number of days required to first inflorescence emergence in a plot

Trait description: The arrangement of flowers on stem or twig of a plant
Method description: Observe the type of inflorescence and score it
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Variable name: Female flowering intensity per spike estimation 1-4
Trait description: Intensity or abudance of female flowers on spikes/infloresences
Method name: Femal flowers abundance or intensity per inflorescence-Estimation
Method description: Observe the femal flowering intensity or abudance per inflorences and rate
Category 4: 4= Long (More than 50% of the tubers sprouted at three month after harvesting time)

Trait description: Mode of plant to plant pollen transfer
Method description: Record the method used to transfer the pollen grains from the anther of a flower to the stigma of a flower of the same or different plant of the same species
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Predominat plant or flower sex
Method description: Scoring the most frequent flower sex type when more than 50% of the plants are flowered

Trait description: Quantity of developed fruits per crosses
Method description: Record the number of developed fruits or fruit set in pollinated flowers/inflorescence

Variable name: Fruit setting time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Times fruit formation or set on monoeciuse or femal flowers of dioeciouse yam plants
Method description: Record the date fruit set in 50% of plants in a plot

Trait description: Times fruit formation or set on monoeciuse or femal flowers of dioeciouse yam plants
Method name: Ability to set or form fruts-Estimation
Method description: Observe fruit setting or formation of female flowers of monoeciouse and dieciouse plants and rate the ability set for form fruits

Trait description: Number of harvested fruits per cross after physiological maturity
Method description: Record the number of harvested fruits per cross

Variable name: Fruit harvest time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time of fruit harvesting
Method description: Record the date of fruits harvest in a crossing block or from plant

Variable name: Fruit maturity time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Times 90% of fruits attain physiological maturity
Method description: Record the date 90% of the developed fruits shows sign of physiological maturity (turning brown)

Variable name: Times to fruit maturity computation in days
Trait description: Times 90% of fruits attain physiological maturity
Method description: Compute the number of days required from fruit set to fruit phyisological maturity

Trait description: Intensity or proportion of fruit set or development under open or controlled pollination.
Method description: Assess the fruit number as fruiting intensity in categorical scale when more than 50% of the plants set fruits
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Intensity or proportion of fruit set or development under open or controlled pollination.
Method description: Compute the fruit set number as proportion of pollinated flowers developing or setting a fruit and expressed in %

Trait description: Fruit development status on monoecious and female flower of dioeciouse yam plant
Method description: Score the degree of fruit development in scale

Trait description: Number of seeds developed per fruit after hand flowers pollination
Method description: Take count of the number of seeds set on each fruits and record the average seeds per fruit
Formula: No. of seeds in fruit 1"+ "No. of seeds in fruit2"+"No. of seed fruit N" divided by "N", where N is the number of fruits seed count attemped"

Trait description: Number of true seed harvested or obained per cross or family
Method description: Record the total number of true seed or botanical seed harvested or obtained per cross or family

Trait description: Fruit index is an estimation of pollinated flowers developing physiologically mature fruits
Method description: Compute the ratio of pollinated florets developing mature fruits

Trait description: Seed index is an estimation of pollinated flowers producing seeds
Method description: Compute the ratio of pollinated florets developing seeds

Trait description: Quantity of botanical or true seeds sown per family or cross
Method description: Record the number of true seeds sown per cross or family

Variable name: Seeds germination start time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time the first seed germination occurred
Method description: Record date the first seed germination observed per cross or family

Variable name: End of seeds germination time estiamtion in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time last seed germination occurred
Method description: Record date the last seed germination observed per cross or family

Trait description: A proportion of sown true (botanical) seed which germinate and produce seedling
Method description: Compute the proportion of sown true or botanical seed which germinate and produce seedling ready for transplant , usually observed at three weeks after sowing.

Trait description: Quanity of sown true (botanical) seeds germinated per cross or family
Method description: Record the number of germinated seedlings per cross or family

Trait description: Establishment rate of seedlings
Method description: compute the proportion of seedlings per family (cross) establish well and ready for transplanting, usually recorded at five weeks after sowing.

Trait description: Establishment rate of seedlings four weeks after transplanting operation
Method description: Compute the proportion of seedlings survived or established well after transplant operation
Formula: [Number of transplanted seedlings survived"/ "number of seedlings transplanted" ]times 100"

Trait description: Vine cuttings planted
Method description: Count the numeber vine cuttings planted

Trait description: Proportion of vine cuttings established well that producing shoots
Method description: Compute the proportion or ratio of vines cuttings survive and producing shoots from the total of planted vine cuttings
Formula: [Number of survived or established plants"/"NVP_cout_number'] times 100"

Variable name: Time to 50% foliage senescence estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time when 50% of the plants in a plot are showing signs of foliage senescence
Method name: Time to 50% foliage senescence time - Estimation
Method description: Record date of 50% plants in a plot are showing foliage senescence

Variable name: Foliage senescence time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Time to all plants in a plot or unit area show full or complete foliage senescence
Method description: Record the date when all plants in a plot shows a sign of 100% foliage senescence

Variable name: Time to 50% foliage senescence computation in days
Trait description: Time when 50% of the plants in a plot are showing signs of foliage senescence
Method name: Time to 50% foliage senescence time - Computation
Method description: Compute the number of days required for 50% of the plants in a plot showing foliage senescence

Variable name: Foliage senescence time computation in days
Trait description: Time to all plants in a plot or unit area show full or complete foliage senescence
Method description: Compute the number of days required from sprout emergence or planting to when all plants had fully senesced

Trait description: Length of time toward crop maturity
Method description: Compute number of growing degree days required from planting (or 50% emergence) to 50% foliage senescence or maturity.
Formula: GDD = Sum[(Tmax +Tmin)/2 - Tbase]. This averaging method and take any negativ record as zero. A base temp 10 ∞C.

Trait description: Foliage senescence or maturity class
Method description: Observe the status of foliage senescence (leaf or vine yellowing) of plants in plot at 6 month onward and rate the maturity status
Category 1: 1= Very Late (all the plants in a plot still show green foliage (green leaf and vine)
Category 2: 3= Late (75% of the plants in a plot with still green foliage but few plants (upto 25% plants in a plot) showing up to 25% of leaves senescence
Category 3: 5= Medium (50% of the plants are still green or on the onset of senescence. Only 50% plants in a plot with 25% of the leaves showing senescence or slight yellowing
Category 4: 7= early (The plants have senescent foliage (75% of the plants in a plot with 50% leaves showing sign of yellowing but the vines still green)
Category 5: 9= very early (The plants are completely senescent, yellowing is complete and uniform (both leaves and vines 100% senescence)

Variable name: Presence of tuber dry rot estimation in 0&1
Trait description: Dry rot caused by nematodes (Scutellonema bradys and Practylenchus spp.) in tubers at harvest
Method name: Dry rot presence on harvested tubers-Estimation
Method description: Observe the occurance or presence of dry rot caused by nematods (Scutellonema bradys and Practylenchus spp.) on harvested tubers and record the presence and absence

Variable name: Number of dry rot tubers count
Trait description: Dry rot caused by nematodes (Scutellonema bradys and Practylenchus spp.) in tubers at harvest
Method description: Take count of dry rot tubers per plot at harvest

Variable name: Tuber dry rot incidence computation in %
Trait description: Dry rot caused by nematodes (Scutellonema bradys and Practylenchus spp.) in tubers at harvest
Method description: Compute the proportion dry rot tubers from the total number of harvested tubers per effective plot
Method reference: Baymei, Coyne and Labuschagne, Crop protection,Volume 28, Issue 9, September 2009, Pages 715-721

Trait description: Dry rot caused by nematodes (Scutellonema bradys and Practylenchus spp.) in tubers at harvest
Method description: Score the severity of dry rot in harvested tubers
Method reference: Baimey, Coyne and Labuschagne, Crop protection,Volume 28, Issue 9, September 2009, Pages 715-722

Trait description: Incidence of leaf beetle damage.
Method description: Compute the proportion of plants with leaf beetle damage from the total number of plants in the effective plots on leaf beetle damange record taken twice(at two and five months after planting date)

Variable name: Leaf beetle damage severity estimation in 1-5
Trait description: Severity of leaf beetle damage.
Method description: Assess the leaf beetle infestation at two and five months after planting and record its severity

Trait description: Incidence of mealybug tuber infestation.
Method description: Compute the proportion tubers infested with mealybugs from the total number of harvested tubers per effective plot at time of harvesting.

Trait description: Severity of mealybug tuber infestation.
Method description: Mealybug tuber severity estimation on infested tubers at time harvesting

Trait description: Root knot incidence caused by Meloidogyne spp.
Method description: Compute the proportion tubers showing root knot nematode symptoms from the total number of harvested tubers in effective plot
Formula: [Number of harvested tubers with root knot nematode sysmptoms or damage in a plot"/"TNTP_cou_tbrp"] times 100"

Variable name: Root knot nematode severity estimation in 1-5
Trait description: Root knot severity caused by Meloidogyne spp.
Method description: Root knot nematode severity estimation in a range from no symptoms to highly severe galling scored in secondary roots of the plant and tubers adventitious roots.

Trait description: Incidence of tuber beetle damage.
Method description: Compute the proportion tubers with tuber's beetle damage from the total number of harvested tubers in the effective plot at harvesting time.
Formula: [Number of tubers with beetle damange in plot"/"TNTP_cou_tbrsplot"]times 100"

Trait description: Severity of tuber beetle damage.
Method description: Tuber beetle severity or intensity estimated usually as number of nymph present in tubers at harvesting time.

Trait description: Reaction of the total plants per plot to the virus infection, producing yellow mottle, mosaic and leaves deformation
Method description: Compute the proportion of virus symptomatic individuals or their parts or commonly the portion of plant units in a plot. Take virus incidence recording thrice: First inspection at 8 to 10 weeks after planting and second inspection after 4 to 6 weeks after first inspection for virus symptoms and the third and final inspection 4 to 6 weeks after the second inspection .
Formula: Number of virus infected or symptomatic plants in a plot divided by total number of plants in a plot times 100.

Trait description: Grade of reaction of the plant to the viruses infection, varying from mottle, mosaics until total leaves deformation
Method description: Observe relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected by virus disease and record the severity as a proportion or percentage of plant surface affected using visual five ordinal scale . Predominant severity per plot must be registered at least thrice : 8 to 10 weeks after planting, 4 to 6 weeks after first scoring and the last scoring at 4 to 6 weeks after the second scoring
Formula: Estimate mean virus severity by summing severity scores >1 in a plot divided by total number of symptomatic plant

Trait description: Anthracnose incidence caused by the pathogen Colletotricum gloeosporioides. % of anthracnose ?blight? or ''leaf spot''affected plants in a plot
Method description: Compute the proportion of anthracnose damaged individuals or their parts , commonly the portion of plant units in a plot. Count anthracnose disease ?blight? or '' leaf spot'' affected plants in plot twice (First inspection at 10 to 12 weeks post planting and second inspection after 2 to 4 weeks before harvesting ) and compute the proportion of damanged
Formula: Number of infected plants in a plot divided by total number of plants in a plot times 100. OR Sum of the proportion of leaf area damage of N plants in plot divided by N

Variable name: yam anthracnose disease severity estimation in 1-5
Trait description: Anthracnose severity caused by the pathogen Colletotricum gloeosporioides. The reaction of plants in a plot to anthracnose infestation (blight or leaf spot) under screenhouse or in the field under natural infestation or artificial inoculation
Method description: Observe relative or absolute area of plant tissue affected by yam anthracnose disease and record the severity as a proportion or percentage of plant surface affected.It is visual score in scale under screenhouse, artificial inoculation or under field natural infestation. For artificial inoculation use a suspension of three most virulent strains of Colletothrichum gloeosporioides and inoculate the plants raised from vine cutting in vertical sack or other means by spraying. For natural infestation, scores can be taken 10 to 12 weeks after planting and second scoring about 4-6 weeks before harvesting . Artificial inoculation should be scored at 3 days after inoculation(DAI) , and repeated at 7DAI, 11DAI and 15DAI
Formula: Estimate mean anthrancose severity by summing severity scores >1 in a plot divided by total number of symptomatic plant
Category 1: 1= No visible symptoms of anthracnose disease or infection spot on the leaf surface
Category 2: 2= Few anthracnose spots or sysmptoms on 1 t0 ~25% of the plant. One or two spots of less than 1 cm diameter width, and dry tissue on the leaf surface
Category 3: 3= Anthracnose symptoms covering ~26 t0 ~50% of the plant. One or two spots of more than 1 cm diameter width, and dry tissue on the leaf surface. Small dark and no dried spots with more than 1 cm width, are present
Category 4: 4= Symptom on >51% of the plant. Coalesced spots with dry tissue and covering a signifcant proprotion of the leaf surface. Areas with less than 1 cm width are coalescing to bigger spots also. Yellowing of green tissue is intense around the spots areas.
Category 5: 5=Severe necrosis and death of the plant. Coalesced spots with dry tissue more than 1.5 cm of diameter and covering a great proprotion of the leaf surface. Yellowing of the gree tissue is generalised in the leaf blade.

Trait description: Number of bulbils or aerial tubers produced
Method description: Count the number of aerial tubers or vine bulbils produced per net plot.

Trait description: Number of bulbils or aerial tubers produced
Method description: Count number of aerial tubers or vine bulbils on plants in a net plot and compute the average number bulbils per plant
Formula: Total number of vine bulbil or aerial tubers produced in a net plot divided by the number of plants producing vine bulbils or an aerial tubers in a net plot

Trait description: Predominant shape of the bulbils
Method description: Record shape of bulbils or aerial tubers in scale
Category 4: 4= Long (More than 50% of the tubers sprouted at three month after harvesting time)

Variable name: Bulbil weight per plot measurement in kg
Trait description: Weight of vine bulbils or aerial tubers harvest
Method description: Record the fresh weight of harvested bulbil or aerial tuber per net plot

Variable name: Bulbil yield per plant measurement in kg
Trait description: Yield of vine bulbils or aerial tubers harvest
Method description: Compute the weight to harvested bulbils per plant
Formula: BulbwtP_M_kgplot"/ "Number of plants producing bulbil in a net plot""

Trait description: Yield of vine bulbils or aerial tubers harvest
Method name: Bulbil yield (fresh weight) per hectar- Computation
Method description: Computed the yield of bulbil per hectare using the formula.

Variable name: Bulbil initiation time estimation in yy/mm/dd
Trait description: Bulbil initiation time
Method description: Record date when 50% of plants in a plot begin producing bulbils or aerial tubers

Trait description: Bulbil initiation time
Method description: Compute number of days required from sprout emergence to 50% of plants in a plot start forming bulbils or aerial tubers

Trait description: Presence of bulbils or aerial tubers in the nodes of the vines
Method description: Record the presence and absence of bulbils (aerial tubers) in the vines of yam plant

Trait description: Number of plants harvested
Method description: Counting the number of plants where tubers were harvested in a plot

Variable name: Big tubers per plot counting number
Trait description: Number of big size tubers that weighing ?1 kg in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Big size tubers harvested number - counting
Method description: Count the number of tubers in a plot weighing ?1 kg harvested per effective plot

Variable name: Medium tubers per plot counting number
Trait description: Number of medium size tubers that weighing ? 0.5kg and <1 kg in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Medium size tubers harvested number- counting
Method description: Count the number of tubers in a plot weighing ? 500 gm and <1 kg harvested per effective plot

Variable name: Small tubers per plot counting number
Trait description: Number of small size tubers that weighing <0.5kg in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Small size tubers harvested per plot number - counting
Method description: Count the number of tubers in a plot weighing less than 500 gm harvested per effective plot

Variable name: Rotten tubers per plot counting number
Trait description: Weight of rotten/diseased tubers
Method name: Rotten tubers in a plot number-counting
Method description: Count the number of rotten and/or diseased tubers in effective plot

Trait description: Number of total (all size) tubers in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Compute the sum of all category/size tubers (big, medium, small and rotten/diseased) in a net plot

Trait description: Number of big size tubers ( ?1 kg) per plant
Method description: Compute the number of big size tubers produced per plant using the formula number of big size tuber in a plot divided by the total number of harvested plants

Trait description: Number of medium size tubers (? 0.5kg and <1 kg) per plant
Method description: Compute the number of medium size tubers produced per plant using the formula number of medium size tuber in a plot divided by the total number of harvested plants

Trait description: Number of small size tubers ( <0.5kg) per plant
Method description: Compute the number of small size tubers produced per plant using the formula number of small size tuber in a plot divided by the total number of harvested plants

Trait description: Number of tubers harvested per plant
Method description: Compute as the total number of tubers in a net plot divided by the number of harvested plant per net plot

Variable name: Weight of big tubers per plot measurement in kg
Trait name: Big size tubers weight per plot
Trait description: Weight of big size tubers ( ?1 kg) in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Big size tubers fresh weight per plot- measurement
Method description: Record the weight of big size ( ?1 kg) tubers in a net plot

Variable name: Weight medium tubers per plot measurement in kg
Trait name: Medium size tubers weight per plot
Trait description: Weight of medium size tubers (? 0.5kg and <1 kg) in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Medium size tubers fresh weight per plot -measurement
Method description: Record the weight of medium size ( ? 500 gm and <1 kg) tubers in a net plot

Variable name: Weight of small tubers per plot measurement in kg
Trait name: Small size tubers weight per plot
Trait description: Weight of small size tubers ( <0.5kg ) in a net plot or unit area
Method name: Small size tubers fresh weight per plot- measurement
Method description: Record the weight of small size ( < 500 gm) tubers in a net plot

Variable name: Weight of rotten/diseased tubers per plot measurement in kg
Trait description: Weight of rotten/diseased tubers
Method name: Rotten tuber fresh weight per plot - Measurement
Method description: Record weight of rotten and/or diseased tubers harvested in a net plot

Variable name: Total tuber weight per plot computation in kg
Trait name: Total fresh tuber weight per plot
Trait description: Total fresh weight of all category or size tubers harvested in a net plot
Method name: Total tuber fresh weight per plot -computation
Method description: Compute the sum all category or size of tubers (Big, medium, small size, and rotten and diseased) fresh weight per plot

Variable name: Total tuber weight per plant computation in kg
Trait description: Total fresh weight of all category or size tubers per plant
Method name: Total tuber fresh weight per plant-computation
Method description: Compute by dividing fresh weight measurement of all categroy/size tubers taken in a plot to the number of harvested plant in a net plot

Variable name: Weight of big tubers per plant measurement in kg
Trait name: Big size tuber weight per plant
Trait description: Weight of big size tubers per plant
Method name: Big size yam fresh weight per plant- computation
Method description: Compute by dividing fresh weight measurement of big size tubers taken to the number of harvested plants in a net plot

Variable name: Weight of medium tubers per plant computation kgplt
Trait name: Medium size tuber weight per plant
Trait description: Weight of medium size tuber yam per plant
Method name: Medium size yam fresh weight per plant-computation
Method description: Compute by dividing fresh weight measurement of medium size tubers taken to the number of harvested plants in a net plot

Variable name: Weight of small tuber per plant computation kgplant
Trait name: Small size tuber weight per plant
Trait description: Weight of small size yam per plant
Method name: Small size yam fresh weight per plant-computation
Method description: Compute by dividing fresh weight measurement of small size tubers taken to the number of harvested plants in a net plot

Variable name: Total tuber yield computation in t/ha
Trait description: Total tuber yield nonadjusted tons per hectare
Method description: Computed as total tuber weight per plot divided by size of net or effective harvest plot and result multiplied by 10

Variable name: Big tuber yield computation in t/ha
Trait description: Big size tubers yield nonadjusted tons per hectare
Method name: Big size yam yield no adjusted- Computation
Method description: Calculated as big size yam tuber weight per plot divided by size of effective harvest plot mutiplied by 10

Variable name: Tuber yield adjusted computation in t/ha
Trait description: Total tuber yield adjusted tons per hectare
Method description: Computed as total tubers weight per plant multiplied by planting density and result divided by 1000
Formula: [TTWPL_FW_kgplt" multiplied by planting density"] and result divided by 1000"

Variable name: Big tuber yield adjusted computation in t/ha
Trait description: Big size tubers yield adjusted tons per hectare
Method description: Calculated as big size yam tuber weight per per plant mutiplied by planting density and result divided by 1000
Formula: [BTWPL_FW_kgplt" multiplied by planting density"] and result divided by 1000"

Variable name: Big tuber average weight computation in kg
Trait name: Average weigth of big size tuber
Trait description: Average weight of big size tubers in kg
Method description: Calculated as weight of big size tubers per plot divided by total number of big size tubers per plot

Variable name: Average tuber weight computation in kg
Trait description: Average tuber weight in kg
Method description: Calculated as total tuber weight per plot divided by total number of tubers per plot

Trait description: Position of appearance of roots at surface of tubers
Method name: Position of root appearance on tubers-Estimation
Method description: Record position of appearance of roots at surface to tubers
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Presence of secondary roots on the tuber bark
Method description: Record the intensity of tuber hairs or secondary roots on the surface of harvested tubers
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Tuber surface look in relation to presence or absence of roots, thorns and sprouted buds on the tuber surface
Method description: Observe the appearance of roots, thones and srout buds on surface of harvested tubers and make visual score using scale
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Tuber surface smoothness
Method description: Record the smoothness or roughness of tuber skin in visual scale

Trait description: Exsistence of thorns on the tuber surface
Method description: Record the presence or absence of thorns or spines on the tuber skin in visual scale

Trait description: Intensity of thorns on the tuber surface
Method description: Record the degree of thorns or spines on tuber surface in visual scale
Category 1: 0= no thorns or spines on tuber surface
Category 2: 3= few thorns or spines on tuber surface
Category 3: 7= Many thorns or spines on tuber surface

Variable name: Big tuber length computation in cm
Trait description: Average length of big size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the length of at most five big size tubers (?1kg) from base to tip in a net plot at harvest and record the average

Variable name: Medium size tuber length computation in cm
Trait description: Average length of medium size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the length of at most five medium size tubers (?500 gm and <1kg ) from base to tip in a net plot at harvest and record the average

Variable name: Small size tuber length computation in cm
Trait description: Average length of small size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the length of at most five small size tubers (<500 gm) from base to tip in a net plot at harvest and record the average

Variable name: Average tuber length measurement in cm
Trait description: Average length of all size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Compute average tuber length of all size tubers measurement taken in a net plot

Trait description: Tuber predominant shape
Method description: Determination of the predominant shape in the entire family/plot as a unit

Trait description: Tuber size
Method description: Determination of predominant size of the tuber in the entire family
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Variable name: Big tuber width computation in cm
Trait description: Average width of big size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the width of at most five big size tubers (?1kg) from net plot at wider portion of the tuber using vernier calliper or measuring tape and record the average

Variable name: Medium tuber width computation in cm
Trait description: Average width of medium size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the width of at most five medium size tubers (?500 gm and <1kg )from net plot at wider portion of the tuber using calliper or measuring tape and record the average

Variable name: Small tuber width computation in cm
Trait description: Average width of small size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Measure the width of at most five small size tubers (<500 gm) from net plot at wider portion of the tuber using calliper or measuring tape and record the average

Variable name: Average tuber width computation in cm
Trait description: Average width of all size tubers harvested in a net plot or unit area
Method description: Compute the average tuber width of all size measurement taken in a net plot

Trait description: Cracks on tuber surface
Method description: Record appearance of cracks on tuber surface as absent, few and many

Trait description: Appearance of crazy roots on tuber surface
Method name: Crazy roots presence on tubers at harvest-Estimation
Method description: Record appearance of crazy roots on tuber surface at harvest

Trait description: Presence or absence of corm on tuber
Method description: Score corm status of tubers using a binary scale

Trait description: Corm separation from tuber
Method description: Record the corm ability to be separated from tuber in a binary scale

Trait description: Size of corm in relation to tuber
Method description: Record corm size in relation to tuber size using three scale

Trait description: Corm type
Method description: Record the corm type as regular, transversally elongated or brached using scale

Trait description: Tuber dormancy period
Method description: Assess the proportion of sprouted tubers at different time interval (once a week) from harvesting up to three months after harvesting and rate the dormancy period in scale
Category 4: 4= Long (More than 50% of the tubers sprouted at three month after harvesting time)

Trait description: Proportion of dry matter in the tuber.
Method description: Select at least five random whole tubers from a net plot and cut small slices (1-2 mm) from proximal, middle and distal portion and mixed thoroughly. Record fresh weight and determin dry weight of samples by drying at 70∞C for 72 h in a forced air oven. A proportion between the dry weight and the fresh weight is calculated.

Variable name: Tuber flesh color upper portion estimation 1-9
Trait description: The surface color of the yam tuber flesh
Method name: Tuber flesh color head portion - Estimation
Method description: Observe and record the fresh cut tuber flesh surface color at the head portion of the tuber at harvesting time.

Variable name: Tuber flesh color middle portion estimation 1-9
Trait description: The surface color of the yam tuber flesh
Method name: Tuber flesh color middle portion - Estimation
Method description: Observe and record the fresh cut flesh surface color at the middle part of the tuber at harvesting time.

Variable name: Tuber flesh color lower portion estimation 1-9
Trait description: The surface color of the yam tuber flesh
Method name: Tuber flesh color lower or tail portion- Estimation
Method description: Observe and record fresh cut tuber flesh surface color at the tail portion of the tuber at harvesting time.

Trait description: The surface color of the yam tuber flesh
Method description: Measure the flesh surface color of tuber (head, middle and tail portion) at different time interval (0, 30, 60, 180 minutes after cutting) using colorimeter (a color spectrophotometer) or standard color chart.

Variable name: Uniformity of tuber flesh color estimation binary 0&1
Trait description: Uniformity of tuber flesh surface color in cross-section ( from cortex to center)
Method name: Tuber flesh cross section color uniformity-estimation
Method description: Record the uniformity of tuber flesh cross-section color using visual scale at fresh cut during harvest

Variable name: Intensity of tuber flesh oxidation estimation 0-3
Trait description: Intensity of tuber flesh enzymatic oxidation (degree of flesh color change or browning of cut yam tuber)
Method description: Score the intensity of tuber flesh oxidation (flesh surface color change) at different time interval (0, 30, 60, 180 minutes after cutting) using scale

Trait description: Texture of tuber flesh
Method description: Record the texture of tuber flesh using scale
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Tuber flesh enzymatic oxidation rate
Method description: Record time in minutes lasted for cut tuber flesh to become or not oxidized and score in scale
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Surface color resulting of tuber flesh enzymatic oxidation
Method description: Record the flesh enzymatic oxidation color using color scale
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Degree to which particles of a sample stick together or how moldable it is
Method description: Score the degree to which particles of a pounded yam stick together or how moldable it is using intensity scale
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Distance to which the deformed material can be sretchable
Trait synonyms: tretchability or elasticity of pounded yam
Method description: Score the distance to which the deformed material can be or degree of stretchabiliy pounded yam in intesity scale

Trait description: Smoothnessof the material, i.e., absence of lumps
Method description: score the smoothnessof the pounded yam , i.e., absence of lumps by finger feeling and using intensity scale
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Presenceof ?ber strands
Method description: Score the presence or absence of ?ber strands on pounded yam

Trait description: The degree to which the pounded yam is adhesive or stick to the fingure, mouth surface and teeth
Method description: Score the sticknes or adhesiveness of pounded yam to consumern fingur using sensory test panelist

Trait description: Taste of pounded yam when eaten without any additional complementary food
Method description: Score taste of pounded yam using sensory test panalist

Trait description: Scale insect infestation on tubers at harvest
Method description: Observe and score scale insect infestation on tuber at harvest

Trait description: The surface color of stem
Method description: Record the predominant color of stem on mature plant at five to six month after emergence using a five color scale

Trait description: Variation in leaf mass of the plant
Method description: Observe the leaf abundance or mass on a mature plant and rate the density

Variable name: Number of branches per plant count
Trait description: Number of branches above ground
Method description: Count the number of branches above ground on at least five mature plants in a plot and record the average

Trait description: Height or the length of stem
Method description: Measure the length or height of stem or vine of at least five mature plants in a plot using measuring tape at five to six months after sprout emergence and record the average

Variable name: Number of leaves per plant count
Trait description: The number of leaves on a plant
Method description: Count the number of leaves on at least five young plants in a plot at 30 days after emergence and record the average

Trait description: Arrangement of leaves on stem or vine
Method description: Observe the arrangement of leaves on stem or vine and rate it
Category 2: 2= oxidizes between 1 and 2 minure after cutting

Trait description: Length of leaf
Method description: Measure the length from lobes to the tip using a measuring tape on sampled 20 adult leaves ( four leaves per plant and at leat five plants on a plot), and record the average length
Formula: (lflngth1+lflngth2+....+lflngthN)/N where N is number of leaves sampled

Trait description: Width of leaf
Method description: Measure the width from the widest part of leaf using a measuring tape on sampled 20 adult leaves ( four leaves per plant on at leat five plants in a plot), and record the average width
Formula: (lfwdt1+lfwdt2+?.+ lfwdtN)/N where N is number of leaves sampled

Trait description: Internode length
Method description: Measure the length of internode at 1m height on five (5) plants and record the average
Formula: (Intndlgth1+Intndlgth2+?.+ IntndlgthN)/N where N is number of plants sampled

Trait description: Hairiness of stem
Method description: Observe the presence or absence of hairs on stem surface

Trait description: The leaf surface color or pigmentation
Method description: Assess the color of leaf on a young plant

Trait description: The leaf surface color or pigmentation
Method description: Assess the color of leaf on a young plant

Trait description: Color or pigmentation of leaf vein
Method description: Assess the color of leaf vein on the upper surface
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Color or pigmentation of leaf vein
Method description: Assess the color of leaf vein on the upper surface
Category 2: 2= Hairy (few scattered or many roots in the surface of the tuber)
Category 3: 3= Thorny (small prominences ending in a small thorn)

Trait description: Hairiness of leaf surface
Method description: Assess hairiness of leaf surface (lower part)

Trait description: Hairiness of leaf surface
Method description: Assess hairiness of leaf surface (lower part)

Trait description: Length of petiole
Method description: Measure the length of petiole using measuring tape on sampled 20 adult leaves ( four leaves per plant on at leat five plants in a plot), and record the average length

Trait description: The optical appearance of boiled yam related with surface glossy or dullness and light scattering power of boiled yam structure
Method description: Observe the appearance (structure and pigmentation) of boiled yam and make visual score using scale how attractive or appealing on table or plate to eat

Trait description: The physical attributes of boiled yam such as soft or hard/strong , smooth or lumpy when sensed by touch in mouth or with hands
Method description: Sensory test of how soft or hard, smooth or lumpy when boiled yam sensed during mastication in mouth or feeling with hand

Trait description: The sense of smell or odor of boiled yam that reaches the nose before eating or the boiled yam reaches the mouth
Method description: Assess the small or odour the boiled yam that sensed at the nose before the yam reaches mouth and make sensory score using scale how appetizing or appealing the boiled yam to eat

Trait description: Optical color or pigmentation of boiled yam
Method description: Observe the optical color or pigementation of boiled yam and make visual score using scale how acceptable or appealing on table or plate to eat

Trait description: Taste of boiled yam when eaten without any additional complementary food
Method description: Feel the taste of boiled yam in mouth and make sensory score using scale how pleasing to the taste

Trait description: The optical appearance of pouned yam related with surface glossy or dullness and light scattering power of pounded yam structure
Method description: Observe the appearance (structure and pigmentation) of pouned yam and make visual score using scale how attractive or appealing on table or plate to eat

Trait description: The physical attributes of pounded yam such as soft or hard/strong , smooth or lumpy when sensed by touch in mouth or with hands
Method description: Sensory test of how soft or hard, smooth or lumpy when pouned yam sensed during mastication in mouth or feeling with hand
Category 4: 4= Long (More than 50% of the tubers sprouted at three month after harvesting time)

Trait description: The sense of smell or odor of pounded yam that reaches the nose before eating or the pounded yam reaches the mouth
Method description: Assess the small or odour the pounded yam that sensed at the nose before the yam reaches mouth and make sensory score using scale how appetizing or appealing the pounded yam to eat

Trait description: The breakdown of yam starch extracted from fresh tubers were determined using a Rapid Visco-Analyser (RVA-TecMaster, Perten Instruments, Australia)
Method description: A 1.7 g portion of starch was mixed with 25 g of distilled water in the RVA sample can, after correction for the original moisture contents of the starches

Trait description: Optical color or pigmentation of pounded yam
Method description: Observe the optical color or pigementation of pounded yam and make visual score using scale how acceptable or appealing on table or plate to eat

Trait description: Both inner and outer colour can range from light yellowish (off-white) to white (pure white)
Method description: Observe the surface of product and evaluate the frequency/number of the black points

Trait description: Brown colour of product after cooking
Method description: Observe the surface of product and evaluate the frequency/number of the black points

Trait description: Purple colour tending to pink after cooking
Method description: Observe the surface of product and evaluate the frequency/number of the black points

Variable name: Boiled yam black spots presence scale 0-100
Trait name: Boiled yam surface black points presence
Trait description: Refers to the presence of small black points on the surface of product
Method description: Observe the surface of product and evaluate the frequency/number of the black points

Trait description: Property related to the adhesion of the product between the fingers
Method description: After breaking or cutting, breaking or crumbling, evaluate the intensity of fine fibers between the fingers and visible to the eye

Trait description: Force required to cut/break with fork
Method description: After breaking or cutting, breaking or crumbling, evaluate the intensity of fine fibers between the fingers and visible to the eye

Trait description: Property of the product to crumble or break between the fingers
Method description: After breaking or cutting, breaking or crumbling, evaluate the intensity of fine fibers between the fingers and visible to the eye

Trait description: Refers to the presence of fine fibers between the fingers and visible to the eye
Method description: After breaking or cutting, breaking or crumbling, evaluate the intensity of fine fibers between the fingers and visible to the eye

Trait description: Refers to the presence of small grains during chewing
Method description: Put the product between the molars and mash it to assess the number of chews before swallowing

Trait description: Property related to the number of chews necessary to swallow the product
Method description: Put the product between the molars and mash it to assess the number of chews before swallowing

Trait description: Odour of boiled yam
Method description: Take a whiff and evaluate the intensity of yam odour

Trait description: Basic light sugary taste like a little glucose or sucrose in water solution
Method description: After swallowing, observe the feeling or sensation of the bitter taste on the tongue and assess its intensity

Trait description: Basic bitter taste like small quantity of quinine or caffeine in water
Method description: After swallowing, observe the feeling or sensation of the bitter taste on the tongue and assess its intensity

Trait description: During chewing, bitter taste after swallowing, eg there is a light bitter aftertaste
Method description: After swallowing, observe the feeling or sensation of the bitter taste on the tongue and assess its intensity
